job_description:
For over ten years, HappyFunCorp has been helping businesses develop great products and deliver technical solutions with a blend of strong engineering skills, human-focused design, and culture that makes working with us enjoyable. We’ve worked closely with startups as well as Fortune 500 companies to innovate across a variety of verticals. Originally headquartered in Brooklyn, NYC, we are temporarily fully remote.

Our team of over 70 sharp and talented engineers, designers, and product architects hail from diverse backgrounds, bringing empathy and business savvy to every project and relationship we take on. Whether you’re looking to take an idea from concept to production, improve an existing product, or handle a complicated digital transformation project, we can help.

Responsibilities:
• Experience interacting with clients at all levels (from c-suite to operational partners) to define a product vision, capabilities & roadmap
• A curiosity for analyzing business problems to identify solutions that will address the client’s goals
• Experience in product delivery generating artifacts that will ensure alignment across the team & increase the quality of delivery.
• The ability to establish healthy communication channels within the team to ensure milestones are met, avoid scope creep, and that risks along the way are identified and communicated, to help ensure the successful launch of the product
• Experience working within a resource budget & identifying features/tradeoffs are effectively prioritized to ensure the team remains on track
• Experience working with the various disciplines to effectively ensure the team remains on track

Requirements
• Experience working on cross-functional software development teams that includes project teams that are spread across numerous time zones
• Strong technical understanding of how products are built and a track record of leading and delivering large products and services
• Capable of defining and managing product roadmaps while weighing time/budget constraints along with creative problem solving given these constraints
• Excellent leadership and communication skills exemplifying the ability to collaborate with designers, developers and business stakeholders while maintaining transparency and setting clear expectations
• Experience with agile and waterfall project management methodologies
• Familiarity with project management and communication tools (e.g. JIRA, Notion, Figma, Google Doc, Slides etc)
• Excellent analytical problem solving and decision-making skills

Benefits

COMPANY VALUES
• Creative Optimism. We are problem-solvers who use a lens of opportunity to make the world a bit better with all that we do.
• Dignity. Our best work can only be done in an environment in which HFCers and our partners treat each other – and themselves – with dignity.
• Equity. We strive for diversity across many dimensions and we believe our team is strongest when it is fairest.
• Entrepreneurial Spirit. Our “engine” is the energy that comes with ownership, agency, and responsibility for what we produce.
• Trust The bedrock of any organization is the growth of trust in our leaders, peers, and partners – the most rewarding work demands it.

HFC is a good fit for entrepreneurially-minded doers that learn and adapt quickly and have a passion for what they do. What we look for is someone with experience turning ideas into fully-fledged products. We offer competitive pay, a fully remote company culture, and the opportunity to work on cool projects with great people. If this sounds like you, send us your application!

Junior Product Manager

YouMail Position #3000

Location:
USA/Remote

Department:

Job Description

YouMail is looking for a passionate, talented junior Product Manager to join our Product Management Team and help define and drive development of our applications and services. You will work alongside with talented designers and technologies to deliver products immediately into the hands of hundreds of millions of users.

This position can be full-time or part-time and can be contract-based (if located outside of California).

Responsibilities:
• Act as the hub for all teams with regards to product strategy and development, liaising with the Executive Team, Customer Care, Marketing and Engineering groups
• Identify opportunities, build business cases and understand/analyze user needs
• Define product features and functions with particular focus on delivering the best, most intuitive end-user experience
• Capture before and after scenarios for evolving product features along with functional requirements
• Define metrics for understanding the engagement and impact of products and features
• Develop wire-frames, mock-ups or similar pre-engineering prototypes for discussion and review as part of the development process
• Work with engineering to determine fine-grained development priorities, balancing functional and technical requirements
• Own the delivery of products and features into the hands of customer, continuing to monitor and track end-user engagement and usage

Requirements

What You Bring
• Experience in consumer-facing services of applications, specifically mobile products is preferable but not required
• Motivated, driven and results-oriented
• Good design skills, specifically applied to UX and human factors
• Experience with analytics and A/B testing processes
• Passion to act as customer advocate and develop optimized consumer experiences
• Excellent communication, organization and analytic skills
• Experience with lean/agile processes and rapid development iteration
• Experience of fluid ability cross-functionally, balancing needs of multiple stakeholders
• Strong time-management skills with ability to balance multiple competing priorities
• Flexibility in fast paced, ever-changing environment

Salary and Benefits Range: $50k to $120k

job_description:
Company Description

Experian plc is an Anglo-Irish multinational consumer credit reporting company.

Experian collects and aggregates information on over 1 billion people and businesses, including 235 million individual US consumers and more than 25 million US businesses.

We operate in 37 countries with offices in the United Kingdom, the United States and Brazil.

We employ approximately 17,000 colleagues, and last fiscal year, our year-end revenue was US$5.18 billion.

Our product proposition covers credit services, Decision Analytics and marketing assistance to businesses, including individual fingerprinting and targeting.

Job Description

The role of a product analyst is to support product team in making data informed decisions through analysis of data relating to product and how it is being used by clients. The insights drawn from the data analysis are used to drive next best decision in order to retain clients and maximise profits. These decisions relate to pricing, optimization of existing products and development of new products. The analyst will be required to analyse internal data relating to usage and pricing together with market research, engaging existing clients on what could be improved.

Qualifications
• BSc in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, BCom

Additional Information

What you’ll be doing
• Identify valuable data sources and automate collection, loading and transforming processes.
• Developing new datasets.
• Provide rapid feedback and insight on ad-hoc requests.
• Develop and Maintain Pricing Model
• Provide analyses and insights that will help Product Managers with their strategic objectives.
• Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges.
• Collaborate with client and product development teams.
• Undertaking data collection, pre-processing and analysis.
• Creating reports and presentations for business uses.
• Managing and administrating monthly business processes.
• Client (Internal/External) Communication.
• Market Research
• Monthly Reporting
• Documenting Business Requirements

What you'll need to bring to the party
• Analytical mind and business acumen.
• Strong math skills (e.g. statistics, algebra).
• Problem-solving aptitude.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills.
• Ability to work independently and with team members from different backgrounds.
• Excellent attention to detail.
• A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
• Import and Export data from different database technologies.
• Process automation and monitoring.
• Data Cleansing
• Data profiling

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

job_description:
Our 100% remote Product Analyst within our Technology Solutions team plays a vital role in researching, defining and determining business and high-level design requirements for our mobile solutions, particularly our ELD (Electronic Logging Device) on both Android and iOS systems. This includes defining the client experience and needed changes to related back-office systems, and supporting the business-related aspects involved with product/service delivery. Experience working with both Android and iOS systems is important in this role, as well as familiarity Maui/Xamarin would be a plus.

Job Responsibilities
• Creates business requirements to include a business and project plan/concept document for each new and redesigned/envisioned product/service offering or feature enhancement, including working with business unit to define business needs, project requirements, system specifications, and deliverables.
• Becomes a subject matter expert for topic and service deliverables related to the product/service, including regulatory expertise as applicable. May participate in customer/market needs analysis to identify product enhancements that address those needs.
• Oversees feature prioritization, grooming, and minimal viable project (MVP) scope management in partnership with the Development teams, including utilizing technical toolsets and methodologies.
• Prepares documentation and support materials for product/service line enhancements, for example meeting minutes, business case reports, sales training, market research, price change information, etc.
• Communicates new/envisioned service deliverables to affected business areas and helps the operational areas define service delivery needs. In some areas, may also help determine the overall cost of goods for service delivery.
• Troubleshoots system errors and performance problems so that the business needs are met on a timely basis. Provides assistance on complex support questions or functional questions.
• Analyzes recurring service issues and client enhancement requests to identify improvement opportunities.
• In some areas, supports and delivers training on new products/services with sales enablement and company stakeholders as needed.
• Provides on-going service and business support with sales, clients, and internal stakeholders.
• Collaborates with technical teams, end users, management, and other stakeholders to facilitate activities, maintain on-going communication, and coordinate decisions based on business requirements, system functionality, and best business practices.

We provide a competitive benefit package which includes the following (eligibility requirements apply): Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance, 401(k) and Profit Sharing Plan, etc.

job_description:
Junior Product Owner

Remote

12-month contract

The Junior Product Owner serves {functional area} as the voice of the customer to guide development teams in building software capabilities with the highest business and customer impact.

They have experience in Product Owner practices, but are willing to learn the applications they support, and actively investigate and learn from other ways to improve practices.

The Junior Product Owner anticipates or sees gaps in other teams and offers assistance until those gaps can be filled. They represent business needs and priorities, prioritize and manage the product backlog, recommend developers for backlog items based on knowledge of the developer’s experience, and incorporate feedback from business stakeholders to guide continuous product improvement.

The Junior Product Owner is accountable for the delivery of business outcomes but works with the domain's Director and Sr. Manager for completing multiple high, or one or more products of the greatest complexity.

Minimum 2 years of recent experience with the title “Product Owner”.

Retail Experience is a +

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45.74 - $50.89 per hour

• Product Owner: 3 years (Preferred)
• Retail: 3 years (Preferred)

job_description:
What You'll Do

This Product Manager will deliver a robust product roadmap and backlog using their expertise in product management, customer experience, business process mapping and automation, and agile delivery. They will also leverage their design thinking (client journey, Persona, UX/UI), multi-interface experiences (web and mobile channels), multi-facet data applications for internal and external usage, and system development life cycle processes.

Duties & Responsibilities:
• Manage a product roadmap that balances stakeholder inputs, customer needs, and innovative explorations
• Learn, manage, and look for improvements to our core products that manages the top 15% enterprise customers as we roadmap how to migrate technology to from an older tech stack to modern technology
• Design a product platform with UI's, APIs, services, and data-driven insights that deliver unique experiences across the customer journey
• Work with release teams to prioritize the product backlog based on client demand, business cases, product KPI, strategic business goals (customer R&D, competitive, market)
• Explore internal and external use cases and deliverable products revolving around SaaS and BaaS offerings
• Work in an agile environment to overcome roadblocks and develop recommendations for delivery issues, change requests, pre-release QA, and production issues
• Provide clear vision and scope documentation, initiatives, epics, and stories to support development
• Monitor product performance with reports, dashboards, and periodic stakeholder reviews
• Conduct competitor analysis based on current offerings, technology trends, customer needs, and future product offerings
• Collaborate and partner with 3rd party vendors / alliances to enhance product offering
• Work with leadership teams to conduct cost analysis research to define pricing models and go-to-market strategies for new and substantially enhanced products

What You'll Bring

Knowledge of:
• Proven track record of managing the end-to-end product development lifecycle (PDLC) for early-stage growth initiatives
• Bias towards experimentation but not afraid of making an educate decision
• Driven and team oriented
• Experience managing development costs related to product profitability

Ability to:
• Possess a positive, team-oriented attitude and inspiring leadership skills a must
• Strong leadership presence; comfortable interacting with and presenting to all levels of management
• Strong ability to analyze opportunities & problems, recommend solutions, and communicate effectively & confidently (both verbal and written)
• Strong influencing and partnership / collaboration skills to drive cross-functional teams

EDUCATION AND TRAINING
• 5+ years in product management with a focus on life cycle experience in defining and launching world class products.
• 3+ years’ experience in the Banking, Financial, or Fintech space as a product manager.
• 2+ years' experience in web and mobile based software experience.
• Familiarity with loan origination, collections, and loan management a plus.
• Experience with product and road-mapping software, such as JIRA, ADO, Aha!, or Asana.
• Bachelor's degree required.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Duties are performed in an office setting and include physical demands such as the manual dexterity and skill to operate standard office equipment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be considered an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills of the people so classified.

Remote Eligible In: Illinois, Indiana, Missouri, Florida, Georgia, Texas, Ohio, Iowa, Michigan, South Dakota

A team with diverse talent, working together, is essential to Busey’s commitment of delivering service excellence. Busey is an Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Vets. Visit Busey.com/Careers to learn more about Busey’s Equal Opportunity Employment.

job_description:
The role of Junior Product Manager will have marketing, product strategy, portfolio strategy, and revenue growth responsibilities. They will be responsible for supporting/leading the development of go-to-market strategies, strategic product decisions, articulating the product offering, crafting innovative competitive messaging, and leading product launch efforts. This position reports directly to the in vivo portfolio owner within the Product Management Department.

Responsibilities
• Portfolio strategy - Candidate will be responsible for managing in vivo portfolios to define the strategies to ensure in vivo portfolio growth goals are achieved through various marketing, product development, and other commercial initiatives
• Product vision - Analyzing market, customer and competitive conditions, and identify emerging scientific trends and technologies for the purpose of creating a product vision that is differentiated and delivers unique value based on customer demands
• Market assessment - Identify appropriate market opportunities governed by the market dynamics in the region, competitive landscape, solution/service needs, sales approach
• Campaign creation and marketing strategy - Partner with the Marketing Manager and Content Manager to develop go-to-market strategies, consistent with branding, positioning and messaging relating to Crown Bioscience and its products & services globally
• Cross-functional collaborations - Ensure close alignment and open communication with R&I Scientific Leaders, Marketing, Business Development, Site Leaders, and Corporate Development to position the services and solutions of the in vivo portfolio
• Use strategic and competitive intelligence to inform product iterations, new product development, messaging, and competitive positioning strategies
• Build and execute a product road map based on strategic decisions and market conditions
• Monitor and evaluate on competitive landscape
• Define product vision based on providing unique, differentiated value to customers
• Ensure ongoing engagement with target customer base through voice of customer activities
• Work with the wider marketing team to develop annual marketing plans at both a platform/portfolio and regional levels, and maintain and execute a marketing calendar of campaigns
• Ensure sales teams are trained and can articulate the value propositions of established and new services within the in vivo portfolio
• Use market insight to develop content and customer engagement strategies through digital and traditional communication channels
• Monitor the global and regional market to identify competitive gaps and potential technology/product/service licensing opportunities
• Maintain scientific/technical knowledge of the assigned portfolio and its impact on the market

Minimum Requirements
• Master's degree in life science or related scientific field
• Scientific knowledge of in vivo or oncology/immuno-oncology and end-point assays a plus
• Strong communication skills are a must
• Strong project management skills and the ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage multiple projects, simultaneously.
• Demonstrated ability to collaborate and interact effectively with individuals, and influence individuals, across functional areas and in team environments.

Preferred Requirements
• Master's degree in life science or related scientific field
• Scientific knowledge of in vivo or oncology/immuno-oncology and end-point assays a plus
• Strong communication skills are a must
• Strong project management skills and the ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage multiple projects, simultaneously.
• Demonstrated ability to collaborate and interact effectively with individuals, and influence individuals, across functional areas and in team environments.

job_title: Junior Product Researcher (Salt Lake City, UT or Remote - US)
job_description:
PDQ, founded in Salt Lake City, UT, makes device management simple, secure, and Pretty Damn Quick. IT teams use our products to reduce complexity, improve efficiency, and enhance control in their unique environments. We are backed by TA Associates, a top-tier global PE fund. SimpleMDM and SmartDeploy are powered by PDQ.

PDQ is seeking a Product Researcher to join our talented UX team! In this role, you will provide product research across our family of products while synthesizing customer interviews and analytical insights. The ideal candidate has previous experience in conducting user research for SaaS products and working with ambiguous data to identify potential product improvements or trends. Working with the product managers, you will be responsible for collecting and analyzing product usage data, retention data, purchase data, and more – using this data you’ll identify opportunities to improve the product.

How you might spend your day:
• Conducting research and analyzing data to make data-driven decisions, detect trends, and measure product success
• Collaborate with the product team to create new features and improve existing functionality
• Research designs to evaluate and validate wireframes and prototypes
• Plan, coordinate, and facilitate in-depth user interviews (or apply other methodologies to assess opportunities and identify user needs)
• Advocate on behalf of the user in business decisions; advise stakeholders based on user data
• Engage with team members in peer review of research and design
• Effectively document research and test results for Product Managers and Engineers
• Estimate accurate timelines for deliverables, while being flexible as priorities change

Who you are:
• Bachelor’s degree in design, marketing, communications, psychology, human factors, or related field OR equivalent work experience
• 1 years professional experience in UX Research or Product Research (B2B SaaS) preferred

We're looking for people who have:
• Experience conducting research and analyzing data in order to make data-driven decisions and measure product success
• Experience working with cross-functional teams to define and test new features
• Knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods
• Strong interpersonal skills, as well as the ability to communicate between teams

Tools we have:
• Slack
• Microsoft O365
• Figma
• Mixpanel
• Grain (for customer interviews)

Do you think you have what it takes but don’t necessarily meet all the requirements? Apply anyway - you could be exactly who we are looking for!

PDQ offers all of the great perks and benefits you'd expect from working at a very cool tech company, and even some you might not expect, including:

4-Day Work Week

Managers who champion professional development and are technically experienced (the best kind of experience)

100% Premium Coverage for medical, dental and vision for you and your dependents

100% Premium Coverage for Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, Life, and AD&D Insurance

Company match of the first 6% of your team member deferrals

Flexible Paid Time Off Policy that treats you like the adult that you are

Health Savings Account (HSA) and wellness incentives

Quarterly Company Values Award (team member nominated)

PDQ is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, state, or local law. If you would like to request reasonable accommodation for a medical condition or disability during any part of the application process, please contact hr@pdq.com.

At Lenovo, we are dedicated to transforming our customers’ experience with the next generation of technology. Lenovo’s Commerical workstation brand is built on the pillars of performance and reliability, through our innovation and design. We empower our customers by understanding their exact needs, technical requirements, and business outcomes.

With its state-of-the-art portfolio of workstations co-designed with luxury automotive manufacturer Aston Martin, Lenovo is paving the way with advanced technology solutions. As part of the Global Workstation & Client AI Business Unit we are looking for an experienced NVIDIA Solutions Product Manager to support the growth of our professional workstation business. job_description: Junior Product Manager Austin, TX / Product / Full Time / On-site Apply for this job Who is Fortress? Fortress Trust is a technology-driven financial institution offering custody, payments, compliance and operational infrastructure powering the next generation of neo-banks, marketplaces, exchanges and Web3 innovators. Traditional financial services for alternative assets (NFTs, cryptocurrencies, securities, etc) are hard to find, and even then are slow, manual, and fragmented. We built Fortress to serve the industry with a friendly attitude and frictionless technology! Fortress offers integrators a comprehensive API-driven financial ecosystem, including compliance, data vaults, personal, business, royalty, IRA, and asset protection trust accounts along with our payment infrastructure including credit card, wire, ACH, and crypto. Join an amazing team of former crypto regulators, bankers, engineers, entrepreneurs, and industry leaders. The ambitious goal of Fortress is to provide a suite of Web3 infrastructure products and services for NFT and crypto innovators. With the embeddable wallet and minting engine from Fortress Wallet, to digital asset custody solutions from Fortress Trust, we exist to support and/or provide solutions for our customers to build extraordinary businesses around Web3. Job Summary: We are looking for a junior product manager driven by first principles to build our evolving world-class products. The product manager will execute strategic initiatives and maximize ROI through the research and development of our product suite. This will be an opportunity to work on a diverse set of product challenges ranging from APIs to enable crypto trading, IRA for investments, credit card processing systems, integrations to banking systems, and so much more. This is an opportunity to be early in our product-market fit and to help establish the go-to-market with a well-funded and well-positioned company. We already have the first version of our products live with early customers onboarded and using our product. If you are seeking an opportunity to have an impact and grow as a product manager, let s chat! This role will reside in the office with the rest of our product team in Austin. Responsibilities Collaborate with the Heads of Product and work with design and engineering to drive the return on investment of the ideation and development of your products. Help with the strategic direction for our products (product vision, strategy, and prioritization), through data analysis and research Collaborate with the Heads of Products to get alignment on MVP definition & design, MVP versions (including alpha & beta), and go-to-market phases of product development Champion the voice of the customer and users by gaining an understanding of target market segments, UX personas, pain points, and customer journeys. Deliver measurable business impact by aligning team efforts on the highest value opportunities. The Right Person(ality) Seeking growth, impact, and autonomy. Driven to work with teams of highly conscientious, diverse, high-performing, and talented experts. Driven to execute and accountable for decisions. Possess a beginner s mindset and long-term orientation. Act with strong interpersonal, analytical, and communication skills combined with intellectual curiosity. Enthusiastic about crypto, web3, and blockchain technology. Experience in the tech field or education in STEM fields Experienced in managing and collaborating with teams of engineers and designers. Familiar with standard product management tools, roadmaps, and analytics (JIRA, Confluence, etc.). Experience working with data and metrics to confirm assumptions and make decisions. job_description:
We are a growth stage company that creates software solutions combining lean principles, predictive and prescriptive analytics, and machine learning to transform hospital and infusion center operations. More than 180 health systems and over 685 hospitals across 49 states rely on our award-winning products to increase patient access, decrease wait times, and reduce healthcare delivery costs. We have raised more than $300 million from top-tier investors such as Bain Capital, Insight Partners, and Goldman Sachs. We have been named among the top 100 AI companies in the world.

Please note that while this role is listed as available for remote, we are currently employing in the following states: AK, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, FL, GA, IL, IN, KS, LA, MD, MA, MI, MO, MT, NH, NJ, NC, OH, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, WI. If your state is not listed, we may not be able to proceed with your application. We have offices in Santa Clara, CA and Charlotte, NC for employees who prefer to work regularly or occasionally from an office.

You will be working with a cross-functional team made up of developers, product designers, QA, and data analysts, in addition to regularly collaborating with other teams and stakeholders, both internal and external. This role requires a combination of deep technical skills, business acumen and interpersonal skills.

What You’ll Do
• Build a deep understanding of customer needs and pain-points, traveling on-site when necessary
• Analyze metrics, customer and prospect feedback, internal stakeholder feedback, and market trends to identify the highest value opportunities
• Act as the “glue” and drive collaboration across Product, Engineering, Design, Data Science, Analytics, Marketing, Customer Engagement, Product Implementation, Operations, and more
• Define and hit measurable and specific goals tied to short, medium, and long-term business outcomes
• Own the prioritization of the roadmap and backlog and make it visible to the rest of the company
• Partner with other product teams to help track cross-functional dependencies and plan integrated roadmap delivery
• Manage projects from definition all the way through to release and implementation
• Collaborate with various stakeholders to integrate ML and AI tools into the product
• Act as or on behalf of the expert in various contexts and be able to speak reasonably well to the relevant scopes based on the different stakeholders involved
• Shield the team from requests and interruptions, while managing external stakeholders and keeping everyone in the loop
• Delight our customers and make sure we are always improving the product experience

What You’ll Bring
• Minimum 4 years of experience in product management, where you were responsible for the product roadmap, or equivalent role
• Experience working with and/or building predictive and prescriptive analytics tools
• Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
• Experience working with data science models and AI/ML
• Excellent teamwork skills, with demonstrated ability to collaborate and influence across functions
• Experience in the healthcare or health-tech industries
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including experience presenting to senior leadership and customers

What You'll Get
• Intellectual and emotional satisfaction of solving tough operational problems in healthcare while improving patient access and saving lives!
• Competitive compensation package that includes base salary, annual bonus, and stock options
• 401(k) Match
• Comprehensive healthcare benefits
• Generous Paid Time Off and Parental Leave
• Monthly reimbursement for Skill Building
• Monthly reimbursement for Wellness, Transportation, and/or Home Office
• Education Reimbursement for select courses/programs

$95,000 - $135,000 a year

The offered base salary will reflect careful consideration of a number of factors, including your location, skills and qualifications, prior relevant experience, internal equity and market conditions. This range may be modified in the future.

Vaccination policy

We have an obligation to protect our employees, our customers, and the patients of our customers. Therefore employees are required to be vaccinated to work from the office, attend in-person company events, or to travel on behalf of the company.

Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

ECP is a market-leading SaaS software solution that enables senior living communities to better care for their residents. ECP is used in over 2,000 communities around the world. We're looking to further expand by increasing the number of customers that use our software and increasing the scope of how we serve our customers by developing and releasing new products.

We're looking for an experienced product manager that is excited to make an impact at a fast-growing 60-person company. This role will report to our Director of Product Management.

job_description: Job Description: Phreesia is seeking a smart, energetic and highly motivated Senior Product Manager to join our Integration team, focusing on Healthcare Systems bidirectional integrations such as importing/exporting patient demographics or clinical and exporting the same or payments. As a Senior Product Manager, you will be driving product initiatives through the full product life cycle.  This includes having a strong understanding of the market and our competitors, collaborating with internal product teams, defining detailed requirements, collaborating with engineers and executing on product launch plans. As a Senior Product Manager, you will work closely with our clients, partners and internal stakeholders to build and iterate on our fastest growing products. You will collaborate with our product management, engineering, operations, marketing, clinical engagement, and sales teams to deliver amazing product and boost adoption and utilization. The ideal candidate will be a solid communicator, a great problem solver, will be able to work with cross-functional teams, and will demonstrate strong leadership abilities and the desire to learn and mentor. What You'll Do Own the vision, strategy, and outcomes for some EMR/EHR integrations within the portfolio Be a product champion within our company and for our clients  Understand market problems and needs Develop detailed product requirements & translate into user stories for implementation by engineering  Drive product go-to-market strategies and execute successful launch plans with the support of product leadership, market development, client success and the marketing team. Build business cases for new features and feature enhancements by collaborating with product leadership marketing, sales, and operations groups.   Provide product support and training to sales and operations teams  Manage escalations, investigate issues and prioritize fixes What You'll Bring Bachelor's degree required At least 5 years of product management experience preferably in a high-growth B2B SaaS environment using an Agile development methodology Passion for making a difference in healthcare and improving access to care Previous experience working on EMR/EHR integrations strongly preferred Experience with FHIR ideal Ability to thrive under pressure and function effectively in a fast-paced environment, providing strong leadership skills while managing multiple projects simultaneously. Experience leading product initiatives across multiple product teams Deep interest in user experience, creating, and analyzing products Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well in a team environment Excellent analytical, problem-solving, organizational, written and oral communication skills Strong organization and project management skills Previous experience mentoring of more junior Product Managers ideal Base pay for US is $115K to $145K USD, depending on qualifications. In addition, Phreesia also offers equity as part an attractive & comprehensive Total Rewards package. Who We Are: At Phreesia, we’re looking for smart and passionate people to help drive our mission of creating a better, more engaging healthcare experience. We’re committed to helping healthcare organizations succeed in an ever-evolving landscape by transforming the way healthcare is delivered. Our SaaS platform digitizes appointment check-in and offers tools to engage patients, improve efficiency, optimize staffing, and enhance clinical care. Phreesia cares about our employees by providing a diverse and dynamic work environment. We’re a five-time winner of Modern Healthcare Magazine’s Best Places to Work in Healthcare award and we’ve been recognized on the Bloomberg Gender Equality Index. We are dedicated to continuously improving our employee experience by launching new programs and initiatives. If you thrive in a culture of recognition, value inclusivity, professional development, and growth opportunities, Phreesia could be a great fit! Top-rated Employee Benefits: 100% Remote work + home office expense reimbursements Competitive compensation + equity grants for all employees Flexible PTO + 8 company holidays Monthly reimbursement for cell phone + internet + wellness 100% Paid 12-week parental leave to our U.S. employees, as well as a generous parental benefit to our employees in Canada Variety of insurance coverage for people (and pets!) Continuing education and professional certification reimbursement We strive to provide a diverse and inclusive environment and are an equal opportunity employer. At Phreesia, we’re transforming the patient experience and giving healthcare organizations the capacity to do more—and we need smart, innovative problem-solvers to help us get there. Phreesians have a wide range of backgrounds—you don’t need to be a healthcare expert or a technology geek to succeed on our team. We’re looking for talented, diverse individuals who want to make a difference in healthcare.

Junior Product Manager

Candidate must reside in the U.S.A.

About the Company:

CORE Business Technologies is a leading provider of payment and engagement solutions for healthcare, government, and higher education. CORE directly impacts our clients’ bottom line while enhancing their payments and engagement solutions, and operational initiatives. Our solutions are used by some of the most prestigious and highly recognized organizations in the country and we are growing organically and through acquisition. We are on a mission to be the single most valuable end-to-end provider of payments and engagement solutions for our customers. We are searching for a highly motivated aspiring Junior Product Manager to join our team.

We are seeking a talented and motivated Junior Product Manager with a strong interest or prior experience in payments and software as a service. As a Junior Product Manager, you will play a crucial role in shaping our products and driving their success in the market. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, marketing, and customer support, to define product requirements, develop strategies, and deliver exceptional payment solutions to our clients.

CORE Values

The leader in this role should exemplify our CORE values. Our employees value these things:

Stay Present & Get It Done

We stay accountable, driven, and humble. We do what we say we're going to do because our interactions are grounded in empathy, collaboration, and growth. We do exceptional things.

Evolve & Adapt

We are open to new ideas. We believe that change is a critical component of success. We don't let mistakes hold us back. Rather we learn, grow, and get better. We focus on results that matter which helps us overcome obstacles and deliver unparalleled success.

Cultivate Fans

We are fans of each other, our customers, and the work we do. We partner closely with our customers to deliver transformative solutions. Our perspective and experience drives better business.

Primary Responsibilities
• Gain a deep understanding of the Government payments industry, including trends, regulations, and customer needs, with a focus on SaaS-based payment solutions.
• Collaborate with senior product managers to develop and execute product strategies, aligning with the company's vision and business goals.
• Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and user feedback analysis to identify market opportunities and customer pain points.
• Define and prioritize product features, functionalities, and enhancements based on market demands, customer feedback, and business priorities.
• Create and maintain detailed product documentation, including user stories, specifications, and wireframes, to guide the development team throughout the product lifecycle.
• Collaborate closely with engineering teams to ensure timely and high-quality product delivery, providing clear and concise requirements, conducting regular sprint reviews, and addressing any development challenges.
• Work closely with the design team to create intuitive and user-friendly interfaces that meet the needs of both business users and end customers.
• Collaborate with the marketing team to develop go-to-market strategies, including product positioning, pricing, and promotional campaigns, to drive product adoption and revenue growth.
• Monitor product performance, conduct data analysis, and gather user feedback to identify areas for improvement and drive product optimization efforts.
• Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in payments and SaaS, continuously enhancing your knowledge and skills.

Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, or a related field. MBA or relevant postgraduate degree is a plus.
• Previous experience or strong interest in the payments industry and software as a service (SaaS) products.
• Solid understanding of product management principles and practices, with knowledge of Agile methodologies.
• Excellent analytical skills with the ability to gather and interpret market research and user data.
• Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex concepts to cross-functional teams.
• Detail-oriented mindset, ensuring accuracy and quality in all aspects of product management.
• Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment and manage multiple priorities with a sense of urgency.
• Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills, with the ability to identify and address product-related challenges.
• Familiarity with project management tools, wireframing tools, and data analysis tools is preferred.
• Passion for innovation, technology, and the drive to make a significant impact in the payments industry.

Why Join CORE

This is an opportunity to join a growing technology company in a very exciting space with unlimited upside and the ability to help establish culture and impact the company’s success. CORE values people who share our values and we offer great benefits including:
• Amazing people and an opportunity to make a real difference in a smaller company.
• Work with our subject matter experts and find your niche.
• A hybrid workplace to ensure optimal balance of safety, time management, and intracompany collaboration.

job_description:
Position Purpose:

The Product Management Manager is responsible for attracting, retaining and developing top talent focused on assessing market needs and inspiring cross-functional product teams to find the fastest way to achieve value around those needs. The Product Management Manager focuses on guiding and executing the delivery of business value to drive sales, improve efficiency, and improve customer satisfaction through the production of quality products. Within their designated enterprise product line, Managers work closely with teams of developers, designers and business partners. They support in-depth business reviews, communicate and present across all levels of the organization, and support cross-functional product teams.

Key Responsibilities:

30% Strategy & Planning:
• Looks across product teams and feature sets with a focus on alignment and dependencies
• Gains a thorough understanding of customer and associate needs, both existing and potential, and uses that knowledge to help deliver enterprise products that provide Home Depot customers and associates with an unparalleled shopping experience
• Translates business goals and end user needs into product strategy and clearly communicates direction and product priorities to the product team and business partners
• Meets with users and stakeholders as needed to understand processes, pain points and system waste in order to identify where to improve the user experience
• Creates epics to drive improvements to product vision, features and back end systems, and adjusts for new business models
• Determines value to the business of anticipated product updates
• Identifies goals, metrics and appropriate analytics to measure the performance of products and continually makes recommendations and refinements to products based on learnings

40% Delivery & Execution:
• Reviews recommended solutions and work of product team to ensure products are aligned with company, stakeholder and end user priorities
• Documents, reviews and ensures that all quality and change control standards are met
• Removes roadblocks and obstacles that may impair product teams to help ensure delivery of the product in order to meet strategic, financial and technical goals
• Receives and prioritizes incoming requests from business partners and stakeholders while keeping in mind the business strategy, product vision and user needs
• Provides regular updates to leadership regarding progress of products within portfolio

30% People:
• Provides leadership, mentoring and coaching to Product Managers
• Attracts, retains and develops top talent to build a world class Product Management Team
• Conducts annual and mid-year reviews, reviewing individual development plans and providing performance feedback
• Fosters collaboration with team members (Engineering, UX, etc.) to drive value and identify and resolve impediments
• Acts as a proponent of modern software development practices
• Advocates for the end user and stakeholder by becoming associated with the product, empathizing with and understanding user needs
• Works with the product team to continuously assess progress, disseminate lessons learned and understand next steps
• Manages cross functional team and stakeholder expectations to execute on product strategy and provides education to requestors to determine prioritization based on tangible benefits and/or user experience
• Guides more junior team members in strategy, alignment, analysis and execution tasks

job_description:
Get to know us

Do you want to help us shape what the future of work will look like and how it will best embrace our life's aspirations? If this sounds like a journey you want to embark on, we may have the right role for you!
PayFit is an intuitive cloud-based payroll and employee management solution designed specifically for SMBs. Since 2015, we have set ourselves a mission to simplify payroll for SMBs and enable employers and employees to grow together. We are a European company operating from 3 main countries (France, Spain, and the UK) where we are supporting over 9500 clients.

Creating a fulfilling work environment and culture is also a core mission at PayFit, and our day-to-day work philosophy is reflected in our four values:

Care
We genuinely care for others whoever they are, whatever they think
Excellence
We aim to improve and achieve better results every day
Humility
Staying humble and exchanging transparent feedback helps us to grow and improve
Passion
We are the architects of PayFits success

A key part of our culture, and essential for our success, is also improving the diversity of our teams and building an inclusive culture where you can be yourself at work.

This is why our recruitment focuses on the skills you demonstrate, and not only on your academic background or previous professional experiences. At PayFit we understand that you can gain applicable skills through a variety of life experiences and we are interested in knowing them, too.

PayFit, it's also a team of more than 30 design experts from different domains: Product Designers, Design Ops, User Researchers, Brand Designers... We all have great rituals to learn from each other on everyday basis and grow as a team.

What will be your role ?

By joining the Time On Squad, you will participate in the development of a very strategic part of the product, ensuring the best user experience.
You will work in a Triforce mode, collaborating closely with the Product Manager and Engineering Manager on a daily basis.
You will report directly to the Design Manager of the Time Team.
The Time On Squad is part of the Payroll Experience Tribe, surrounded by a great team of experts, you will have the opportunity to grow in skills on multiple subjects.

To give you more context, here's some more information about the Time On Squad!

Scope Time On is mostly focused on building a time management module for employees and employers (Tracking time spent on projects, Clock-in / Clock-out, etc.)
Team The team is composed by a Product Manager, Engineering Manager, 2 Engineers and 2 Product Builders.
Projects The Squad is currently working on new top-secret features, while still implementing different UX improvements.

Your missions

Accompanied by the Design Manager, you will be responsible for the user experience for the scope of your squad.
You will practice the double diamond design process from beginning to end: translating research insights taken from users and stakeholders into user journey and design pixel perfect mockups that engineers can easily implement.
You will follow the delivery part, while collaborating closely with the developers in the squad.
You will actively participate in the rituals of the squad.
You will contribute to the research of the new features, and make decisions based on research and data.
You will find new UX/UI improvements in the product and suggest them to the team.

This job has been tailored for you if :

You are a student in digital design (product design, UX, interaction design, etc.) and you're fluent in english
You have an up-to-date portfolio primarily with UX/UI references.
When you design interfaces, you think first and foremost about what will be the added value of your solution that will answer your user's needs.
You're comfortable with Figma.
You love researching and working on a project from A to Z (the whole discovery phase) and you know the value of user testing and have already put it into practice.
You are meticulous and have a strong eye for detail.
You have strong interpersonal skills and good communication skills and you enjoy working in a collaborative setting, as part of a team.
You are comfortable speaking & writing in English to exchange with the team.
Working with remote teams does not scare you, and video conferencing is no secret to you.

Our recruitment process

1. Discovery interview with Eleonore, our Talent Acquisition Specialist ( 20')
2. Presenting one of your projects to Malija, Design Manager ( 45')
3. Last interview with one of the members of the Squad ( 20')

What we offer

Flexibility: We believe that to produce your best work and to be fulfilled, you should be free to choose what working arrangements suit you best. You can work from anywhere in France, with a face-to-face meeting in our Paris office at least once a month.
Learning & Development: In PayFit we have a great learning platform where you can learn new skills every day with the support of our company.
Health promotion: A Gym at our Paris office and a GymLib subscription with a preferential rate. 4 paid sessions with a mental health practitioner and online support with Moka.Care.
Health Insurance: Mutuelle Henner (60% covered by PayFit).
Meals: A restaurant card with our partner Swile .
Transportation: 50 % of public transportation card covered by PayFit .
Work equipment: a MacBook as our standard working tool.
Time off: 5 weeks of holidays + RTT.

Disability Inclusion
All of our positions are open to any person living with a disability. To guarantee equal treatment and opportunities, we will take, based on individual needs, appropriate measures to adapt the work conditions of PayFiters with disabilities, and if needed also during the recruitment process.

job_description:
If you want to join as a remote team member at a profitable, high-growth startup, where you will be a key member of the product team, making sure that we’re building the right product in the right way, fulfilling the desires of thousands of entrepreneurs, and bringing to life functionalities they haven’t even thought of yet, all while gaining vast, practical hands-on experience, then this Product Owner position is THE job for you.

This is the startup position where you’ll build a killer resume, since in 1 year here you’ll learn more than 5 years in a typical role. Not only that, but if you can succeed in this role, we want you to grow with us.

Who we are…   

We’re Vidalytics.com. A video marketing platform that helps entrepreneurs scale their businesses in the face of bigger, better-funded competitors. We do this with the advanced tools in our video marketing & hosting platform. We’re 6 years old    and growing 50-100% per year. And you’re going to be a part of the team that will add a few zeros to that growth rate.

This is a rare chance to step into a management role in a startup, where you can grow with us, without all the early pain of getting product market fit, revenue, profitability or fundraising. We’ve already done the hard part, now it is scaling time.

At a glance…   
• Report to the Head of Product, a serial entrepreneur, who is in love with UX and design.
• You will be making sure our team of developers has all the specifications they need to build the product the way we dream it.
• Our shared goal is to have a well-oiled machine that can go from idea creation to production features seamlessly.
• You’ll be in charge of GSD (getting shit done) in product, which means owning the short-term product backlog and WIP (see more below).
• You’ll be the person accountable for getting features built with all of the possible use case scenarios in mind.
• This job is all about getting your hands dirty with putting pieces together.
• Kick ass, and continue to grow with us as we scale, e.g. you will grow in responsibilities.

What will it be like working at Vidalytics?   

We are a product-led company (which also has a big marketing focus). Our product has grown so much in the past few years because we deliver attractive features that marketers love, and they spread the word amongst them about what we provide to them.

You’ll play a significant role in bringing new features to life and ensuring our users and leads get a product that helps them grow their businesses faster.

The team members that will be helping you are…
• CEO / CMO – Patrick. He sets the strategy at a very high level around the product, since he takes care of the Marketing department as well, and is actually also our ideal customer! (Hence why he’s also the face of the brand… Vidalytics is his brainchild).
• Head of Product – That’d be me, Erika    I have a tight grip on who our users are, what they are saying about us, and what they expect… which I use to set priorities in our roadmap and backlog. I manage our designers and QA testers. I’m also a UX specialist and have a good understanding of visual design. We’ll work closely together to determine what the definition of done is for our features, and to move them from “dev done” to our users’ hands.
• Head of Engineering – The maestro of the development department, and who has the last word when it comes to how to implement a feature (architecture, etc.)
• Developers – All the team members bringing our cool features to life.
• Designers – The artists behind the features.
• QA – Our QA tester will use your acceptance criteria to create test cases and make sure the feature the devs build works to our expectations.
• Customer Happiness – The front line in our relationship with the outside world. These folks will bring to us feature requests and feedback for us to dream of new functionality for the app.

Who You Are (Personality Type)   
• Organized.
• Detailed oriented. You get things right, without losing yourself in the weeds.
• Biased towards action.
• Tech savvy — you’re not afraid of the technical topics of marketing (analytics, tech, split testing, media buying).
• Resourceful & self-sufficient – You’re able to figure things out, with minimal instructions.
• Curious – You’re always thinking about “what if…”
• Not afraid to get your hands dirty, even if that means rolling up your sleeves to do something that isn’t your job.
• You’re hungry for knowledge and like to learn.
• You are reliable. You show up when you say you will, and get shit done.
• Accountable to deadlines and results. You get results, even when the unexpected arises.
• You can take direct honest feedback AND you can give the same.
• You embody Vidalytics’ values (read more here about Vidalytics’ values, and no these aren’t just things we say to fill up space in our job posts).

What You’ll Be Doing (Job Tasks)   
• Reviewing designs – reviewing what our designers produce, based on the Head of Product’s requirements. Making sure that the designs account for all possible use case scenarios and that they are of very high quality.
• Writing acceptance criteria – translating said designs into a series of technical requirements that guide the development time when building features. You will describe in great detail how all the parts of the feature work, keeping in mind interactions between features, accessibility, and any other criteria that increases product quality.
• Meeting with the product team – to review our roadmap, product feedback, and to plan ahead, as well as to report the current status of the backlog and discuss improvements to the product workflow.
• Understanding our users and industry – as a PO, you’ll be expected to understand what our users expect of the product. Thus, you’ll be required to understand the audience we cater to so you can better identify users’ needs and even prioritize features.
• Analyzing data from our database – this might not happen right away, but in time you might want to take a look at what product usage looks like, so you can make more informed decisions when backlog grooming time comes. You should feel comfortable going through product usage data, at least at a high level.
• Grooming the backlog – with information gathered from the executive team, our users and the dev team, you should be able to help prioritize the backlog so it makes sense at all levels (business, development, customer happiness).

We’d Love to Hear From You If (Job Requirements)     
• You can crush the tasks listed above
• You’ve done this type of work before and been successful (we will check references)
• You have native English ability
• You have a bias toward action
• Have a curious nature
• You’re detail-oriented
• You’re VERY organized
• You’re in Europe and or the Americas, and are able to have a good overlap with European working hours

What You’ll Love About Us (Benefits and Perks)   
• Great company culture. You’re going to be part of a team, not a cog in a machine.
• We’re here to enable you. It’s your work and your career. Our leadership team is here to help you become who you want to be, not to micromanage you.
• We value your ideas. At Vidalytics, my door is always open. Need help? Let’s talk! Have a vision for the future of the company? I want to hear it.
• Rest and relaxation. Employees enjoy a generous PTO package.
• Professional development. Want to continue your education? Vidalytics pays for classes, conferences, and more.
• You’re more than an employee, you’re a person. Every co-worker you’ll meet is committed to treating you with respect and kindness. You won’t hear stuff like, “It’s just business.”
• This is a resume-making position, where you’ll learn a lot and have a lot of responsibility. You don’t have to wait for someone to die or retire to move up, like in a mega-corp. You’ll grow with us!

Vidalytics’ Values

(Yes, We’re Actually Serious About These)   

1 – Meritocracy – we’re building a Meritocracy, where the best ideas win — not based on who has the bigger title. The following values underpin this. You should embody these traits.

2 – Direct & honest communication (transparency) – to be successful we have to face the truth and be honest. And that starts with each other. That means we give direct feedback. We want it in exchange. So feel free to argue your points, just be ready to get onboard with decisions once they are made.

3 – Ownership & Accountability – the best people are the ones who OWN their position, tasks and even things that go beyond their ‘day to day responsibilities’. They never say, “that’s not my job.” Instead, they proactively spot problems and always try to think like the owner of the business.

4 – Intelligence and smarts – we prize smart people. Who doesn’t? But it’s not just book smarts but “business smarts” where you’re able to solve problems. Think for yourself. And don’t be intimidated by any problem, no matter how complex. (Aka growth mindset).

5 – Self-aware (personal growth) – we want people who can look at themselves objectively, admit their mistakes and be open to growth. When you bring this attitude to your profession, it becomes a place of personal development and self-actualization.

6 – Integrity – trust is the glue that holds us together. We need to be able to trust you whether it is regarding the quality of your hours, the deadlines you set for yourself or anything else.

7- Urgency – we’re a startup and you need to be able to meet deadlines. We need someone who pushes themselves when they need to and hits deadlines. And also knows how to prioritize the important things.

8 – Hard working – we’re trying to get shit done on a budget. If you’re looking for an easy job, go elsewhere. Instead, this job will constantly have challenges and opportunities to learn and grow professionally. But we try to have fun while we’re doing it and consider each other friends.

9 – Data – whenever possible, we want to make decisions based on data, not emotions or opinions.

10 – No assholes – Doesn’t matter how good someone is at their job, if they are going to make life suck for other people on the team, then they aren’t welcomed at Vidalytics.

Cheers,

    

Erika Lehmann

Co-Founder / Head of Product @ Vidalytics

job_title: Junior Product Manager - Analytics at Take-Two Interactive in New York City
job_description:
Who We Are

Headquartered in New York City, Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. is a leading developer, publisher, and marketer of interactive entertainment for consumers around the globe. The Company develops and publishes products principally through Rockstar Games, 2K, Private Division, and Zynga. Our products are currently designed for console gaming systems, PC, and Mobile, including smartphones and tablets, and are delivered through physical retail, digital download, online platforms, and cloud streaming services. The Company’s common stock is publicly traded on NASDAQ under the symbol TTWO.

While our offices (physical and virtual) are casual and inviting, we are deeply committed to our core tenets of creativity, innovation and efficiency, and individual and team development opportunities. Our industry and business are continually evolving and fast-paced, providing numerous opportunities to learn and hone your skills. We work hard, but we also like to have fun, and believe that we provide a great place to come to work each day to pursue your passions.

The Challenge

We are looking for a Junior Product Manager to play an integral part in providing reliable automated reporting to our labels. As a subject matter expert for our marketing analytics platform, you will facilitate technical and non-technical conversations with key players – vendors, insight managers, data scientists, and engineers. To be successful, you should be comfortable with a level of ambiguity when solving problems. Attention to detail is vital, but so is keeping your eye on the bigger picture. We're looking for someone who is intellectually curious and not afraid to dive into complex data!

What You’ll Take On
• Partner with business owners to define the marketing analytics platform roadmap. Prioritize features and solutions according to value and business needs
• Collect, connect, harmonize, and QA new data sources, provide regular ticket support to label partners, and build dashboard prototypes
• Ensure solutions are current by staying up to date on vendor platform capabilities and training
• Empower users beyond what is currently known or solved with keen attention to continuous improvement
• Create and maintain documentation for both new project requirements and solution design
• Investigate low adoption, promote capabilities, and evangelize use cases that help business users to achieve more with existing tools
• Stay current with emerging technology and strategies used to support the customer experience and present findings on a regular basis
• Work autonomously, with strong organizational and time-management skills

What You Bring

If you meet most but not all these requirements, we still encourage you to apply:
• 2+ years of related experience in highly quantitative (i.e. data analytics, performance marketing) or engineering role(s)
• Hands on experience with Datorama, Snowflake, Tableau or other data tools/platforms
• Intermediate SQL skills and understanding of relational databases
• Experience working with data sets of various types and sizes. Bonus points for experience pulling data from APIs
• Solid understanding of how paid media campaigns are trafficked in paid media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Google, etc.) and the related performance data available
• Foundational awareness of marketing platforms, business intelligence, visualization, data structures, database management, and data security
• Experience managing multiple projects with different partners simultaneously

What We Offer You
• Great Company Culture. Ranked as one of the most creative and innovative places to work, creativity, innovation, efficiency, diversity and philanthropy are among the core tenets of our organization and are integral drivers of our continued success.
• Growth: As a global entertainment company, we pride ourselves on creating environments where employees are encouraged to be themselves, inquisitive, collaborative and to grow within and around the company.
• Work Hard, Play Hard. Our employees bond, blow-off steam, and flex some creative muscles – through corporate boot camp classes, company parties, game release events, monthly socials, and team challenges.
• Benefits. Medical (HSA & FSA), dental, vision, 401(k) with company match, employee stock purchase plan, commuter benefits, in-house wellness program, broad learning & development opportunities, a charitable giving platform with company match and more!
• Perks. Fitness allowance, employee discount programs, free games & events, stocked pantries and the ability to earn up to $500+ per year for taking care of yourself and more!

job_description:
We are looking for an experienced Product Manager for a large, global B2B Software company. This role will be responsible for managing the overall lifecycle of the product, expanding the usage of the product across the organization, and designing the overall reporting metrics for measuring the success of the product.

This is a 6-month project (Extension Possible), 40 hours per week, Remote role in the US.

This is a W2 employee of Stage 4 Solutions. Health benefits and 401K are offered.

Responsibilities
• Manages the overall implementation (not development directly) and evolution process of a company's products and services.
• Coordinates departmental or cross-functional teams, focused on delivering new or upgrading existing products.
• Monitors the project from initiation through delivery including planning and directing schedules and monitoring budget/spending.
• Organizes cross-functional activities, ensuring completion of the project i.e. product on schedule and within budget constraints.
• Thrive in a matrix-type organization; it does not have responsibility over product development and requires a technical background in order to complete its overall product lifecycle stewardship.
• Periodically report the metrics to the leadership teams.
• Collect feedback for product improvement/enhancement.
• Manage relationships with all the stakeholders of the product.

Requirements
• Must have significant Product management experience in Saas or tech.
• Good understanding of developers' persona their challenges and the DevOps lifecycle
• Good experience managing stakeholders.
• Bachelor's degree

Please submit your resume to our network at http://www.stage4solutions.com/careers/ (apply to the Product Manager - Software (Remote) role).

Please feel free to forward this job post to others you think may be interested.

Stage 4 Solutions is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to providing employees with an inclusive environment that is free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions are based on the job requirements and candidates' qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion/belief, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, genetic information or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Compensation: $65/hr. - $70.05/hr. on W2

Good understanding of developers' persona their challenges and the DevOps lifecycle
Good experience managing stakeholders
Bachelor's degree

job_description:
Why World Travel, Inc.? A big reason is that we are an employee-owned company. That means you own a part of the company and share in our success! We offer competitive compensation, benefits – healthcare, wellness, and paid time off. There is opportunity for growth and promotion to leadership positions for small teams, management level, and executive positions.

Associate Product Manager

Location: Exton, PA, or Remote

Objective of the Position:

The Associate Product Manager is responsible for the ongoing success of the following product categories: Virtual Payment Solutions, Unused Ticket Tracking, and Travel Approval Solutions. The associate product manager oversees all components of their assigned products throughout the entire product lifecycle – from inception to retirement. This includes assisting the director of product management with defining and executing strategy to maximize value and competitive marketing positioning while ensuring profitability.
• *Product categories are subject to change based on organizational or customer needs and market conditions***

Job Summary:

The Associate Product Manager will be responsible for the following core components of each product under their assigned product line; (1) Assisting in defining product strategy, (2) Collecting customer feedback and helping in prioritizing requests and bug fixes into release cycles (3) Key resource in defining value proposition to securing funding from c-level executives for development resources, (4) Qualifying products for market release, (5) all product related communications both internally and externally, (6) ensuring adequate support structures and procedures are in place and are being followed.

Essential Functions:

The duties and responsibilities for this role include but are not limited to the following:

Collect Voice of the Customer feedback and insights to create meaningful user stories and use cases.

Maintain and prioritize each product’s backlog of feature requests and bug fixes.

Create and present business cases to leadership to secure investments in each product’s major release.

Write functional and business-level requirements and effectively communicate requirements to the development team, travel technology, or vendor partners.

Participate in agile sprint planning and scrum meetings.

Manage stakeholder expectations to ensure timely on-budget delivery.

Assist in defining the short, mid, and long-term product strategy for each assigned solution. This includes market positioning, target customers, features/benefits, and pricing.

Define and execute effective launch plans.

Educate and train customer-facing departments such as account management, sales, and implementations on assigned products. This includes creating sales toolkits, and product datasheets, and acting as the subject matter expert.

Develop adequate support personnel, structure, and procedures to ensure assigned product line releases are successful and issues are addressed in a timely manner.

Work with marketing to define and execute communication plans and promotional campaigns.

Frequent market research to ensure competitive positioning and to identify potential new partners to enhance assigned offerings.

Follow World Travel, Inc. procedures, guidelines, and standards in vendor management, customer service, management information systems, productivity, attendance, and accuracy of work.

Work closely and collaborate with all internal departments, including but not limited to, Sales, Business Development, Legal Account Management, Operations, Consulting, Network Management, etc.

Education and Experience Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in business administration or computer science.

1+ years of travel technology product development experience.

Experience selling or developing technology products with cross-functional teams. Project management experience preferred.

3+ years of direct customer interaction.

Advanced Microsoft Office Suite Skills: PowerPoint, Word, Excel

Experience creating and measuring targeted campaigns to increase product adoption and awareness.

Demonstrated ability to collaborate with vendors and development resources to reach a common goal.

Travel industry experience preferred.

Working Conditions; Schedule:

The work environment characteristics described herein are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

World Travel, Inc.’s offices are traditional corporate offices.

Ambient room temperatures, lighting, and traditional office equipment are as found in a typical corporate office environment.

Must be able to travel up to 15% of the time.

Must be willing to work flexible hours, including evening and weekend hours, to accommodate go-live testing and launch schedules.

Compensation: starting at $75,000

1+ years of travel technology product development experience
Experience selling or developing technology products with cross-functional teams
3+ years of direct customer interaction
Advanced Microsoft Office Suite Skills: PowerPoint, Word, Excel
Experience creating and measuring targeted campaigns to increase product adoption and awareness
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with vendors and development resources to reach a common goal
